description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ajjn6","text":"This is a step-by-step protocol to build a modified FIP (Frame-projected Independent FP) system. FIP was first implemented and reported by Kim et al. (2016). Their protocol is available here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":186,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"3eln1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlto5","text":"We modified previous design so that it can be built mostly with Thorlabs products (still some products from other manufactures are required), which are off-the-shelf and easy to be purchased within a reasonable lead time. The system described in this protocol is designed to record signals from 1)GFP-based sensors, 2)mApple-based sensors,  and 3) iso sbestic signals from up to 4 sites. When applied to measurements of other fluorescent protein-based sensors or spectrally shifted sensors, selection of optical filters and/or excitation light sources should be modified accordingly. Also, the selection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao9jd","text":"of fiber patch cable should be based on the number of simultaneously recorded locations, and diameter/NA of fiber implants. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fd13h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83h5k","text":"We thank Takeo Katsuki Ph.D., (Thorlabs Japan) and Sho Yagishita M.D., Ph.D., (U.Tokyo, Japan) for sharing their galvano-mirror-based photometry design described in Iino et al. (2020). TK also kindly provided CAD model used in this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"031BE3601C1E11EE8FA5B1EC14006CBA","url":"https://sites.google.com/view/multifp/"}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":72,"length":60}],"data":{}},{"key":"bumse","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dq1sa","text":"FLIR-Teledyne","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq6ut","text":"CMOS sensors should be selected based on required frame rate and sensitivity. status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2f7db","text":"Adding optical filters, collimators, and the objective lens","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"asqv5","text":"Assemblying the cubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ckrt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0foq","text":"(This step-by-step part will have corresponding CAD models later.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"et37p","text":"      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c7u73","text":"     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ec2pf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"191F25801C7F11EE8FA5B1EC14006CBA","height":409,"id":388041,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"2tsfa\",\"text\":\"Fig. 1. System Overview\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":23}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"FIP.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48mb3y2f.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48jb3y2f.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48kb3y2f.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48ib3y2f.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"253A25901C1611EE879A0DF2AF94FA3E","height":406,"id":388045,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9ofdq\",\"text\":\"Fig. 2. Design diagram\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":22}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"9lrtj\",\"text\":\"See the Materials section for products used in the setup.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":8,\"length\":10}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2023-07-06 at 8.59.00.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48rb3y2f.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48pb3y2f.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48qb3y2f.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48nb3y2f.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2D8E91901C7A11EE8B6F63B87CEAFF58","height":703,"id":388049,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"48rfl\",\"text\":\"Fig. 3. Spectral features of LEDs, optical filters, and genetic sensor emission signals.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":88}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"epdk0\",\"text\":\"a, Normalized intensity of excitation LEDs (L415M, L470M, L565M), and transmission of excitation band-pass filters (FB410, FB470, FB560) and the dual dichroic filter (FF493_574).\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":3}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"15scp\",\"text\":\"b,  Transmission of the dual dichroic filter (duplicated from a) separating emission spectrum from excitation spectrum (Fig. 1), and normalized intensity of GCaMP6f and jRGECO1a. Note, this design would be suited for most cpGFP- and cpmApple-based sensors.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":4},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":62,\"length\":1},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":120,\"length\":6}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"6itgd\",\"text\":\"c, Transmission of the dichroic filter separating green and red emission signals (FF562), and emission band-pass filters (FF01_520_35 for green and FF01_630_69 for red) \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":3}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2023-07-06 at 20.53.18.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48vb3y2f.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48tb3y2f.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48ub3y2f.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m48sb3y2f.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dej8q","text":"Adjusting angle of collimators so that excitation light coming from fiber patch cables would get roughly uniform.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4alpd","text":"Adjusting the fiber location so that fiber end makes a crisp image on CMOSs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"7pbmu","text":"Although resultant FIP setup will be a fairly optically closed system, in particular during building, experimenter(s) could be exposed to stray light from LEDs. In general, inappropriate use of any Fiber-Coupled LEDs may result in permanent eye damage. To prevent injury, use the LEDs in accordance with the International Standard “Photobiological Safety of Lamps \u0026","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60jo4","text":"Lamp Systems” IEC 62471. The LEDs used in this system fall under RG2 - Moderate Risk Group in accordance to the","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d97f","text":"standard IEC 62471:2006.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
